Detailed Description

Message logging support.

Logging in COMPASS

The logging facility in COMPASS works in a similar manner to printf() except that it has the ability to screen messages for output based on their "level" (e.g. warning, debug, etc.). The log messages go to the log window in the GUI and to standard output in batch mode.

The user may select which kinds of messages he/she wants to receive and the others are silently ignored.

Function Documentation

void create_log_file ( void   ) 

In batch mode, create a log file at program start.

void log_msg ( int  level,
const char *  text,
  ... 
)

Log a message using the given log level.

Note that sending the information to the window and to the file requires that textsw_reset be called if window is destroyed and recreated.

Parameters are an integer for the log level, and then a printf style argument list.

void set_log_file ( FILE *  new_msg_file  ) 

Set the file to write log messages to.

This is useful in cases like testing where errors should just be written to stdout. Note that this does not close the old (if any) message file.
